title: Strong trylocks for reader-writer locks.
abstract: A reader-writer lock provides basic methods for shared and exclusive lock acquisition. A thread calling one of these methods may have to wait indefinitely to enter its critical section, with no guarantee of completion.   We present two new reader-writer  strong  trylock algorithms, where a call to a trylock method always completes in a finite number of steps, and is guaranteed to succeed unless there is a linearizable history for which another thread has the lock. The first algorithm, named StrongTryRW, uses a single word of memory to reach consensus, thus yielding reduced scalability for readers. To address read scalability, we designed StrongTryRWRI which matches in throughput the current state of the art reader-writer lock algorithms.
